intro: Androcera novomexicana, commonly known as the New Mexico bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Androcera novomexicana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
